```{r packages, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse) # data mgmt
library(psych) # easy summary statistics
library(DT) # data tables

library(kableExtra) # format kable objects
```

## Loading created aim2 dataset 
Initial aim 2 data with baseline covariates + repeated imaging measures. See code to create this can be found in the latest file /Users/michellecaunca/Box/habs-315 for Michelle/HABS_M Caunca_Aim 2/1a. data exploration_RaceEthGenImg.
```{r aim 2 data, include = FALSE}
load("/Users/michellecaunca/Library/CloudStorage/Box-Box/habs-315 for Michelle/HABS_RaceEthGenImg/aim2_final_frs.Rdata") # n=3840, v=352
```

## Loading source clinical dataset (baseline)
```{r source clinical, include = FALSE}
# loading in source clinical data from baseline
clinical_1 <- read.csv("/Users/michellecaunca/Library/CloudStorage/Box-Box/habs-315 for Michelle/habs_v6/HABS_datasets_clean_v6/HABS_datasets_clean_v6/clinical hd 1 d6 clean.csv") # n=3838, 1668
view(names(clinical_1))

## taking a quick look at the physical activity variables
summary(as.factor(clinical_1$rapa_1_total))
summary(as.factor(clinical_1$rapa_2_total))

## taking a quick look at one of the medication variables
summary(as.factor(clinical_1$taking_medications)) # 3544 missing, only 252 taking meds
takes_meds <- clinical_1 %>% filter(taking_medications == 1)
summary(as.factor(takes_meds$medication_1_name)) # these medication variables are free-form, so we'll need to go one by one and code a BP variable
summary(as.factor(takes_meds$medication_1_frequency)) 
```
## Creating BP meds variable
The source clinical dataset provide a yes/no BP meds variable. What exists is a variable that indicates if the patient is taking meds (taking_medications), and then 25 variables that code free-form medication names (there are also corresponding frequency and dose variables that I find difficult to make sense of). Per Matt Borzage, he provided some aliases he generated with Tam Pham and provided them to me (see excel sheet).

### Selecting medication variables
```{r meds, eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
# selecting only variables related to taking medciations
takes_meds <- clinical_1 %>%
  select(med_id, 
         taking_medications, 
         (starts_with("medication", ignore.case = TRUE) & ends_with("name", ignore.case = TRUE)),
         (starts_with("medication", ignore.case = TRUE)) & ends_with("frequency", ignore.case = TRUE)) %>% 
  mutate(across(!med_id, as.factor))
# n=3838, v=52
view(names(takes_meds))

# taking a look at the names of meds taken
Hmisc::describe(takes_meds)
summary(takes_meds$medication_1_name)
summary(takes_meds$medication_2_name)
summary(takes_meds$medication_3_name)
summary(takes_meds$medication_4_name)
summary(takes_meds$medication_5_name)
summary(takes_meds$medication_6_name)
summary(takes_meds$medication_25_name)
```

### Creating BP meds variable
```{r BP meds var, eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
BP_meds2 <- BP_meds %>%
  # count up if ppl reported BP meds across bp_med_#
  mutate(any_BP_meds = rowSums(across(bp_med_1:bp_med_25))) %>%
  mutate(takes_BP_meds = case_when(
    any_BP_meds > 0 ~ 1,
    any_BP_meds == 0 ~ 0,
    TRUE ~ NA)) %>%
  select(med_id, taking_medications, any_BP_meds, takes_BP_meds)

# checking variables created
summary(as.factor(BP_meds2$any_BP_meds))
summary(as.factor(BP_meds2$takes_BP_meds))
BP_meds2 %>%
  group_by(takes_BP_meds, taking_medications) %>%
  tally() %>%
  spread(takes_BP_meds, n) %>% view()

save(BP_meds2, file = "./analysis data/BP_meds2.Rdata")
```

# Paring down dataset with only required variables
At visit 1, we will need race/ethnicity (exposure), hypertension (mediator), age, gender (confounders not affected by exposure), and years of education and income (confounders affected by exposure). I also added some cardiometabolic and psychosocial variables that may predict attrition. 

At visit 2, we need imaging variables. We will keep it to global amyloid SUVR, med temp tau SUVR, AD-meta ROI cortical thickness, and logWMHV.

From source clinical data, we will add RAPA_1 and RAPA_2 (measures of physical activity) from baseline. 

From BP_med_2 (derived from source clinical data), we will add newly created takes_BP_meds variable.
```{r want variables, eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
load("/Users/michellecaunca/Library/CloudStorage/Box-Box/habs-315 for Michelle/HABS_RaceEthGenImg/aim2_final_frs.Rdata")
view(names(aim2_final_frs))

load("./analysis data/BP_meds2.Rdata")
view(names(BP_meds2))

# selecting needed variables from our clean aim2 dataset
causmed_1 <- aim2_final_frs %>%
  select(med_id,
         visit_id,
         intdatenew,
         visitcount,
         agenew,
         age_1,
         age_2,
         ethnicity,
         edu,
         gender,
         hasnoinsurance,
         income,
         socsupptot,
         ldl,

         a1c, 
         egfr_nonaa,

         bmi,
         cdx_dep, 
         cdx_htn,
         cdx_cog,
         cdx_dyslipid,
         cdx_cvd,
         cdx_dm,
         sbpavg,
         dbpavg,
         abdaysdiff_1,
         abdaysdiff_2,
         hasabv1,
         hasabv2,
         absuvr_1,
         absuvr_2,
         mriscanner_1,
         mriscanner_2,
         abscanner_1,
         abscanner_2,
         apoe4_positivity,
         apoe4_genotype,
         icv_1,
         taudaysdiff_1,
         taudaysdiff_2,
         taumedtempsuvr_1,
         taumedtempsuvr_2,
         hasmttauv1,
         hasmttauv2,
         tauscanner_1,
         tauscanner_2,
         ctmetaroi_1,

         hasctv1, 
         hasctv2, 
         wmhv_1,
         wmhv_2,
         haswmhv1,
         haswmhv2,
         mridaysdiff_1,
         mridaysdiff_2) # n= 3840, v=60

# clinical
causmed_2 <- clinical_1 %>%
  select(med_id,
         rapa_1_total,
         rapa_2_total,
         gds_total) # n= 3838, v=3

# merging data for analysis
causmed <- causmed_1 %>%
  left_join(causmed_2, join_by(med_id)) %>%
  left_join(BP_meds2, join_by(med_id)) %>%
  mutate(has_htn = case_when(
    (cdx_htn == 1 | takes_BP_meds == 1) ~ 1,
    cdx_htn == 0 ~ 0,
    cdx_htn == 0 & takes_BP_meds == 0 ~ 0,
    TRUE ~ NA)) %>%
  mutate(logwmhv_1 = log(wmhv_1+1)) %>%
  mutate(logwmhv_2 = log(wmhv_2+1)) %>%  
  filter(cdx_cog != 2) # exclude those with dementia at baseline
# n=3592, v=68

# checking  how takes_BP_meds and cdx_htn overlap 
causmed %>%
  group_by(takes_BP_meds, cdx_htn) %>%
  tally() %>%
  spread(cdx_htn, n) %>% view()
    ## 155 folks taking meds who are not in cdx_htn, will create variable to add them and use this as our main mediator 

# checking after I addressed the above 
causmed %>%
  group_by(takes_BP_meds, cdx_htn, has_htn) %>%
  tally() %>%
  spread(has_htn, n) %>% view()

# saving dataset
save(causmed, file = "./analysis data/causmed.Rdata")

# cleaning up workspace
rm(causmed, aim2_final_frs, BP_meds, BP_meds2, causmed_1, causmed_2, clinical_1, takes_meds)
```

## Multiple imputation
```{r mice, eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
# prepping data 
load("./analysis data/causmed.Rdata") #n=3592, v=68
str(causmed)
view(names(causmed))

## identifying categorical variables
catvars <- c("ethnicity", "gender", "hasnoinsurance", 
"smkever", "cdx_dep", "cdx_htn", "cdx_cog", "mriscanner_1", "mriscanner_2",
"cdx_dyslipid", "cdx_cvd", "cdx_dm", "taking_medications", "any_BP_meds", "takes_BP_meds", "has_htn", "apoe4_positivity", "apoe4_genotype", "abscanner_1", "abscanner_2", "tauscanner_1", "tauscanner_2")

## some more data prep
causmed2 <- causmed %>%
  ## re-coding scanner variables to missing if blank 
  mutate(abscanner_1 = ifelse(abscanner_1 == "", NA, abscanner_1)) %>%
  mutate(abscanner_2 = ifelse(abscanner_2 == "", NA, abscanner_2)) %>%
  mutate(mriscanner_1 = ifelse(mriscanner_1 == "", NA, mriscanner_1)) %>%
  mutate(mriscanner_2 = ifelse(mriscanner_2 == "", NA, mriscanner_2)) %>%
  mutate(tauscanner_1 = ifelse(tauscanner_1 == "", NA, tauscanner_1)) %>%
  mutate(tauscanner_2 = ifelse(tauscanner_2 == "", NA, tauscanner_2)) %>% 
  ## converting categorical variable to factor
  mutate(across(all_of(catvars), as.factor)) %>% 
  ## removing some variables that are not needed
  select(!c(agenew, 
            taking_medications,
            any_BP_meds))
summary(causmed2)
view(names(causmed2))

# multiple imputation 
 ## customizing predictor matrix to only include variables that have a min correlation with the outcome 0.4
predictors <- quickpred(causmed2, 
                        minpuc = 0.25,
                        mincor = 0.4,
                        exc = c("med_id",
                                "visit_id",
                                "intdatenew",
                                "visitcount",
                                "abdaysdiff_1",
                                "abdaysdiff_2",
                                "hasabv1",
                                "hasabv2",
                                "absuvr_1",
                                "absuvr_2",
                                "taudaysdiff_1",
                                "taudaysdiff_2",
                                "taumedtempsuvr_1",
                                "taumedtempsuvr_2",
                                "hasmttauv1",
                                "hasmttauv2",
                                "ctmetaroi_1",
                                "ctmetaroi_2",
                                "hasctv1", 
                                "hasctv2", 
                                "wmhv_1",
                                "wmhv_2",
                                "haswmhv1",
                                "haswmhv2",
                                "mridaysdiff_1",
                                "mridaysdiff_2",
                                "logwmhv_1",
                                "logwmhv_2"))

## set seed
set.seed(123)

## imputing covariates 
causmed_imp <- mice(causmed2,
                    pred = predictors, 
                    m = 20,
                    # specifying method for each variable
                    ## if no imputation needed, then will leave blank
                    method = c("", # med_id
                               "", # visit_id
                               "", # intdatenew
                               "", # visitcount
                               "pmm", # age_1
                               "pmm", # age_2,
                               "polyreg", # ethnicity
                               "pmm", # edu
                               "logreg", # gender
                               "logreg", # hasnoinsurance
                               "pmm", # income
                               "pmm", # socsupptot
                               "pmm", # ldl
                               "pmm", # gluc
                               "pmm", # a1c
                               "pmm", # egfr_nonaa
                              # "pmm", # egfr_aa
                               "pmm", # choltot
                               "logreg", # smkever
                               "pmm", # bmi
                               "logreg", # cdx_dep
                               "logreg", # cdx_htn
                               "logreg", # cdx_cog, =0, 1 in this dataset
                               "logreg", # cdx_dyslipid
                               "logreg", # cdx_cvd
                               "logreg", # cdx_dm
                               "pmm", # sbpavg
                               "pmm", # dbpavg
                               "", # abdaysdiff_1
                               "", # abdaysdiff_2
                               "", # hasabv1
                               "", # hasabv2
                               "", # absuvr_1
                               "", # absuvr_2
                               "polyreg", # mriscanner_1
                               "polyreg", # mriscanner_2
                               "polyreg", # abscanner_1
                               "polyreg", # abscanner_2
                               "logreg", # apoe4_positivity
                               "polyreg", # apoe4_genotype
                               "pmm", # icv_1
                               "", # taudaysdiff_1
                               "", # taudaysdiff_2
                               "", # taumedtempsuvr_1
                               "", # taumedtempsuvr_2
                               "", # hasmttauv1
                               "", # hasmttauv2
                               "polyreg", # tauscanner_1
                               "polyreg", # tauscanner_2
                               "", # ctmetaroi_1
                               "", # ctmetaroi_2
                               "", # hasctv1
                               "", # hasctv2 
                               "", # wmhv_1
                               "", # wmhv_2
                               "", # haswmhv1
                               "", # haswmhv2
                               "", # mridaysdiff_1
                               "", # mridaysdiff_2
                               "pmm", # rapa_1_total
                               "pmm", # rapa_2_total
                               "pmm", # gds_total
                               "logreg", # takes_BP_meds
                               "logreg", # has_htn
                               "",  # logwmhv_1
                               "" )) # logwmhv_2

view(causmed_imp$loggedEvents) # many of these are exclusions of highly correlated variables from the imputation model, so I think it's okay

# checking variables after imputation
c1 <- complete(causmed_imp, "long")
summary(c1)
view(miss_var_summary(c1))

# save dataset
save(causmed_imp, file = "./analysis data/causmed_imp.Rdata")
```
